Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] Build Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll for API-28" (#2190) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: 24158d08be1db5a45dfd2ebfe8c05a85bfa8af00
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2189

What do we want?  A reliable way to get `TestResults.xml` files off of
the Android target device, so that we can get unit test results.
A reliable way that works on a variety of Android API levels and their
corresponding emulators.

(What do we want?  ***GREEN BUILDS***.)

The problem with 24158d08 is twofold:

 1. When building an app with a `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)` less than
    `v9.0` (`$(lastword $(API_LEVELS))`), there is a build warning:

        warning XA0105: The $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for 'Foo' (v9.0) is greater than the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for your project (v5.0). You need to increase the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for your project.

 2. When *running*/using `Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll` on an API-10
    device/pre-API-21 device, there is a *runtime* error.

(1) is ignorable, -ish.

(2) is not:

	FATAL EXCEPTION: main
	Process: Xamarin.Android.Locale_Tests, PID: 12615
	android.runtime.JavaProxyThrowable: System.TypeLoadException: Could not resolve type with token 010000d4 from typeref (expected class 'Android.OS.BaseBundle' in assembly 'Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=84e04ff9cfb79065')
	  at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.AndroidRunner.GetSetupTestTarget (Android.Content.Intent intent) [0x00000] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/AndroidRunner.cs:345
	  at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.TestSuiteActivity.SetupTestTarget () [0x00008] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/Activities/TestSuiteActivity.cs:246
	  at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.TestSuiteActivity.UpdateData (Android.Runtime.JavaList`1[T] data, Android.Widget.ListView lv) [0x00006] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/Activities/TestSuiteActivity.cs:137
	  at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.TestSuiteActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle bundle) [0x0003b] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/Activities/TestSuiteActivity.cs:49
	  at Xamarin.Android.LocaleTests.MainActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle bundle) [0x0000d] in C:\Users\peter\source\monodroid\external\xamarin-android\tests\locales\Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests\MainActivity.cs:19

Consequently, while 24158d08 gave *us* a green Jenkins job, the
resulting assembly is not usable when run on Android devices < API-21.

The fix?  Partially revert 24158d08 so that
`Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll` is once again built against
`$(firstword $(API_LEVELS))`, i.e. API-10, and instead update
`Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll` so that instead of using
`Environment.DirectoryDocuments` -- which only exists in API-19+ -- we
use `Environment.DirectoryDownloads` on pre-API-19 devices.

Let's see if this works!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update to Build Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll for API-28 introduces possible breakage for existing XA Unit Test Apps" (#2189) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The recent changes to `Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll` in https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/2182 could cause new issues for users consuming this assembly if the Target Framework Version of the application referencing this assembly is not high enough.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Using a recent d15-9 build, attempt to build and deploy an XA unit test application targeting v5.1 or some earlier version in Debug or Release.
2. I ran into issues when using the d15-9 version of Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests. Seeing as this project does not explicitly set a `TargetFrameworkVersion` or `AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk`, it will by default compile against MonoAndroid 2.3.
https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/d15-9/tests/locales/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests.csproj

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
I am assuming that this breakage is going to be considered acceptable as it has a simple workaround, however we may be able to improve the type of error that could be encountered when an assembly has a higher compile version than the project referencing it. I believe we had talked about wanting to to promote the following warning type to an error[0]. Is that still on the roadmap? This change would help prevent some of the more difficult to diagnose error cases like those described in the 'Actual Behavior' section below.

[0] `warning XA0105: The $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for 'Foo' (v9.0) is greater than the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for your project (v5.0). You need to increase the $(TargetFrameworkVersion) for your project.`

### Actual Behavior
Now that `Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll` is compiled with MonoAndroid v9.0, any projects which reference it and target a lower version are susceptible to breakage. Specific examples from the `Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests` case mentioned in the 'Steps to Reproduce' section are shown below:

#### Release (w/ Link SDK) 
Build error is produced during linking: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-390a9ba93fde4b98b0f13dd2fb58c066.txt:
```
/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2109,5): error MSB4018: The "LinkAssemblies" task failed unexpectedly. [/Users/xamarinqa/myagent/_work/r1/a/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/tests/locales/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests.csproj]
/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2109,5): error MSB4018: Mono.Linker.MarkException: Error processing method: 'System.Void Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.TestSuiteInstrumentation::OnStart()' in assembly: 'Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.dll' ---> Mono.Cecil.ResolutionException: Failed to resolve System.Void Android.OS.BaseBundle::PutString(System.String,System.String) [/Users/xamarinqa/myagent/_work/r1/a/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/tests/locales/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests.csproj]
/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2109,5): error MSB4018:   at Mono.Linker.Steps.MarkStep.HandleUnresolvedMethod (Mono.Cecil.MethodReference reference) [0x00013] in <89c61745fe494f0489d2df2499b02950>:0  [/Users/xamarinqa/myagent/_work/r1/a/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/tests/locales/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests.csproj]
/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2109,5): error MSB4018:   at Mono.Linker.Steps.MarkStep.MarkMethod (Mono.Cecil.MethodReference reference) [0x0004a] in <89c61745fe494f0489d2df2499b02950>:0  [/Users/xamarinqa/myagent/_work/r1/a/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/tests/locales/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests/Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests.csproj]
```

#### Debug 
Test project crashes at runtime: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-1c8489f0f2d947e28d9f3d23c33f4410.txt
```
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615): Process: Xamarin.Android.Locale_Tests, PID: 12615
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615): android.runtime.JavaProxyThrowable: System.TypeLoadException: Could not resolve type with token 010000d4 from typeref (expected class 'Android.OS.BaseBundle' in assembly 'Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=84e04ff9cfb79065')
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615):   at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.AndroidRunner.GetSetupTestTarget (Android.Content.Intent intent) [0x00000] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/AndroidRunner.cs:345 
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615):   at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.TestSuiteActivity.SetupTestTarget () [0x00008] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/Activities/TestSuiteActivity.cs:246 
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615):   at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.TestSuiteActivity.UpdateData (Android.Runtime.JavaList`1[T] data, Android.Widget.ListView lv) [0x00006] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/Activities/TestSuiteActivity.cs:137 
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615):   at Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.TestSuiteActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle bundle) [0x0003b] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/6102/d2851781/source/monodroid/external/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Gui/Activities/TestSuiteActivity.cs:49 
09-17 15:55:11.019 E/AndroidRuntime(12615):   at Xamarin.Android.LocaleTests.MainActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle bundle) [0x0000d] in C:\Users\peter\source\monodroid\external\xamarin-android\tests\locales\Xamarin.Android.Locale-Tests\MainActivity.cs:19 
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "monodroid.so can't find other mono .so libraries in Android Things OEM application" (#1906) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm using a Raspberry pi and running Android Things on it.

The Android Things console allows a developer to upload their applications and include them on the OEM image.

You would then burn this image to a SD Card and use said card in a Raspberry Pi.

In the attached zip, please find
copy of custom powershell scrpt
copy of logcat

I have no way of attaching the .apk files that I have

let me know where to drop them as I am sure they will help in diagnosing whats going on.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a hello world Xamarin Android Application 
2. Set Build Config to Release, Turn off Shared Runtime.
3. Archive the application, creating an apk.
4. Run attached script to remove .so files,add them back uncompressed,zip align and re-sign the apk
5. Create an Android Things Account and create a Raspberry Pi build with latest Android Things version.
        a. Add you new apps apk to the Android Things Build
6. Download develpopment version of the build
7. Burn downloaded .iso to a sd card
8. place SD Card in Raspberry Pi and boot up
9. App begins to boot, but falls over with this error:

06-29 19:30:08.060: W/monodroid(27608): Trying to load sgen from: /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/libmonosgen-2.0.so
06-29 19:30:08.060: W/monodroid(27608): Trying to load sgen from: /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/libmonosgen-32bit-2.0.so
06-29 19:30:08.060: W/monodroid(27608): Trying to load sgen from: /system/lib/libmonosgen-2.0.so
06-29 19:30:08.060: A/monodroid(27608): cannot find libmonosgen-2.0.so in app_libdir: /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm nor in previously printed locations.
06-29 19:30:08.060: A/monodroid(27608): Do you have a shared runtime build of your app with AndroidManifest.xml android:minSdkVersion < 10 while running on a 64-bit Android 5.0 target? This combination is not supported.
06-29 19:30:08.060: A/monodroid(27608): Please either set android:minSdkVersion >= 10 or use a build without the shared runtime (like default Release configuration).
06-29 19:30:08.108: I/ActivityManager(302): Process MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest (pid 27608) has died: fore TOP 

It seems that monodroid cannot find the other .so files.

This is probably due to the following:

1.) The app is installed in the OEM folder
2.) The .so files are read from the apk directly and not copied/extracted during installation

My best guess is that monodroid is looking where the files would be copied if it were a standard application installation.  But since this app is in the oem folder, the libraries are read directly from there in their uncompressed state.

### Expected Behavior
The monodroid library would find and load the libraries in the /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/app.apk

AND NOT look in
/oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/ which does not exist

### Actual Behavior
monodroid library assumes the files location in /oem/app/MicroSemiAudioTest.MicroSemiAudioTest/lib/arm/ and falls over when it cannot be loaded


### Version Information
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 
Version 15.7.1
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.7.1+27703.2000
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03056

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Support DSOs embedded in the .apk" (#2154) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1906

 Support DSOs embedded in the APK

Android API 23 introduced a new way of dealing with the native shared libraries
shipped in the APK. Before that API level, the libraries would be always
extraced and placed in the application data directory, thus occupying more space
than necessary. API 23 added a new manifest `<application>` element attribute,
`android:extractNativeLibs`, which if set makes Android not extract the
libraries to the filesystem. API 23 added a way to load those libraries directly
from the APK. In order to support that there are a few requirements which this
commit implements:

  * DSO (`.so`) files must be stored uncompressed in the APK
  * `<application android:extractNativeLibs="false"/>` must be present
  * DSOs in the APK must be aligned on the memory page boundary (the `-p` flag
    passed to `zipalign` takes care of that

This commit also implements `libmonodroid` suport for loading our DSOs directly
from the APK. This operation mode is enabled by the presence of the
`__XA_DSO_IN_APK` environment variable. This variable is inserted into the
application's environment by way of placing it in the environment file (a file
part of the XA project that is marked with the `AndroidEnvironment` build
action). In that mode, the DSOs are *no longer* looked up in the application
data directory but only in the override directories (if the APK is built in
Debug configuration) and in the APK itself.

Currently, in order to activate the above mode, one has to perform the following
actions manually:

  * Add the `android:extractNativeLibs="false"` attribute to the `<application>`
    element in the `Properties/AndroidManifest.xml` file

  * Add the following property to the project file:
```xml
      <AndroidStoreUncompressedFileExtensions>.so</AndroidStoreUncompressedFileExtensions>
```
  * Add an android environment file to the project with a line which says
```
      __XA_DSO_IN_APK=1
```
After that the application should work in the embedded DSO mode without
problems.

A couple of tests are provided to test building and execution of embedded DSO
application on device, as well as to validate the built APK.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "AppCompat Resources not found In Xamarin Android" (#2188) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Question
I'm trying to access `AppCompat`  resources which usually found under **android.support.v7.appcompat.R**, eg:

```
android.support.v7.appcompat.R.anim.abc_fade_in
```

But in `Xamarin.Android`, all could find under this name space was the `BuildConfig` class:

Android.Support.V7.AppCompat.BuildConfig.
```

1. Create a blank Xamarin.Android Project

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SetUseSafeArea is wiping out Page Padding " (#3809) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Changes in this PR
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/2719

Causes Page Padding settings to get wiped out when you set use safe area to true

### Steps to Reproduce

Set Page Padding in the XAML
```
 x:Class="Triage.Page1">
	<ContentPage.Padding>
		<OnPlatform x:TypeArguments="Thickness" Android="0, 0, 0, 25" iOS="0, 20, 0, 25" />
	</ContentPage.Padding>
```

In code behind set this on the page
```
page.On<Xamarin.Forms.PlatformConfiguration.iOS>().SetUseSafeArea(true);
```

This will cause the Padding set on Android to get wiped out and it will become 0,0,0,0

### Expected Behavior
The Android padding shouldn't get replaced

### Actual Behavior
The Android padding gets zero'd out

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.2
- Last known good version: 3.1

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5375137/45641462-db1dc700-ba72-11e8-81b9-81de4da99411.png)


### Reproduction Link


Another reproduction:
[HeightRegression.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2389711/HeightRegression.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Merge xcode10 into d15-9" (#4820) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- Bump `maccore` that has a bump of `maciostool` that's using `Xamarin.MacDev`'s d15-9 branch.
- No need for extra dependency bumps : `Xamarin.MacDev` in `xamarin-macios` was already using `d15-9` which is equivalent to `xcode10` and `machos-binaries`'s `d15-9` branch is equivalent to `xcode10` too.

_Note: `tools/common/Frameworks.cs` required a bit more work than other files, it's a fusion of https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/9f906918207f8ad19e08d82e0dc4cd2ed5924784 and https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/215ab7fc1aa2f2fd64e944a8115d300630f6f32b._
